messages.body:
Good day,

I hope this mail meets you in good health and
spirit, I am, kelvin West, a sierra Leonia.
Presently, I live as a refugee in republic of
SENEGAL(in west africa), with my younger sister,
Sarah I am a victim of war and the son of late Chief
Dr.Derick Frank West, The assassinated former
assistant director of Sierra Leone gold and Diamond
Mining Corporation.

My father was killed with other government officials
during official Hours when the rebel troops stormed
and raided the mining corporation Office at the heat
of the crisis in my country. A few weeks later, the
Rebels also invaded our residential building in
which my mother and two Of our security men were
killed in the compound while I was out for a Special
research program and my younger sister was in
school. I had a singular shock and trauma, which
compelled us to flee from the Country to republic of
Benin by the help of an army colonel, who is a Close
friend of my late father, I have first degree in
marketing and I would have further my education if
not for the death of my parents. I have never worked
to earn my living since my late parents had enough
Wealth for us.

I am contacting you now because of the present
difficulty i am facing. Unfortunately my father's
two accounts in West Africa have recently been
frozen, however this did not affect the One Hundred
and Ninety Million US Dollars (us$ 190,000,000.00),
which he deposited with a Security for safekeeping.

For now, I am having every information and document
needed for the Collection of the deposit with the
security company and I want you to Act as the
beneficiary of the deposit for easy and smooth
collection to your account abroad for investment
purposes.

You will no doubt be adequately compensated with as
well as a Percentage of the profit from investment
of the fund. Also you will see to it that my sister
and I come over to your country at the earliest
possible time. I am making this request to you with
tears in my eyes and i feel that God almighty will
touch you with his spirit to listen to my cry for
Help and answer me without delay. Since our
breadwinner is no more and this is the only hope for
life. You positive response will give me the
greatest joy and relief.

God Bless you for your kind assistance we have
agreed to offer you 20% of the total sum.

Seriously waiting for your urgent reply, Best
regard.

Kelvin West.

[That's your basic My {Dad/Husband} Was Killed By {Rebels/Government} letter.]

messages.body:
July 12

Dear Mr. Pest,

Thank you for your note.

I have passed it on to three interested parties: Sir
Charles Farnes Barnes (Her Majesty's financial
advisor), Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret and our
Head of Diplomacy, Sir Lonslo Tossov.

Feel free to contact me any time if I can be of
assistance. After all, we would hate for our
substantial investment funds to go West.

Yours ever,

Lady Agatha Bristol, CBE
Head of Special Operations, Foreign Office, London



Tossov: LADY A_IS THIS FELLOW A RELATIVE OF FRED WEST ANOTHER CONTACT OF OURS?_IF SO I AM SURE THINGS WILL BE DISPATCHED QUICKLY ENOUGH -- T


Lonslo Tossov
Diplomat
1 Yanker Ave,
Mbalongawank 123
Via Costeira - Natal
Phone/Fax: +55 (84) 202.1300

Lady Agatha: 
My dear Tossov,
Let us hope so. It would smooth things very well,
rather than a 'two up, sixteen down' transaction that
Fred West preferred.

messages.body:
July 13

Dear Mr West,

As you will have seen from her reply to you, Lady Agatha Bristol passed your e-mail to her to me as besides my work for the Kreplach Brothers Mercanht Bank, I am also the pro bono Bursar of the Lonslo Tossov Foundation. You can see more about the Tossov Organsiation under the Charitable Works section on: www.freewebs.com/tossovinvestments .

Your sad story touched my heart and I will gladly offer you some financial assistance until your father's large amount of money can be reclaimed.

I am prepared to offer you an interest free loan of 20,000 Slovenian silver dorks  upon receipt of your bank details. Our transfers are made via Western Union or our West African merchant bank partners Singh, Loudlie & Offkie who are based in Accra, Ghana.

This would be an interest freeloan binding in honour only, Therefore there would be no bank charges or any fees involved. However, I would have to deduct from the loan a small amount - ten dorks - for the transmission charges.

Naturally I would welcome your assurance that when your father's fortune is finally released, you will pay back this loan.

Please contact me as soon as possible if you would like me to send this money to you.

Yours truly,

Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes VC BSc 

Chief Executive Officer

Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank International
messages.raw:
Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes VC

Your sad story touched my heart and I will gladly offer you some financial assistance until your father's large amount of money can be reclaimed.

I am prepared to offer you an interest free loan of 20,000 Slovenian silver dorks [the equivalent of slightly more than 40,000 US dollars] upon receipt of your bank details. Our transfers are made via Western Union or our West African merchant bank partners Singh, Loudlie & Offkie who are based in Accra, Ghana.

This would be an interest freeloan binding in honour only, Therefore there would be no bank charges or any fees involved. However, I would have to deduct from the loan a small amount - ten dorks - for the transmission charges.

Naturally I would welcome your assurance that when your father's fortune is finally released, you will pay back this loan.

Please contact me as soon as possible if you would like me to send this money to you.

Yours truly,
Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes VC BSc [Economics]
Chief Executive Officer
Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank International

messages.body:
July 13

Dear Mr West,

My colleague Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes has passed your e-mail to me as the Chavster, Manfred and Newman Merchant Bank has specialised in retrieving funds confiscated through military coups etc.

I understand that Sir Charles has offered you twenty thousand Slovenian silver dorks as an interest free loan to be paid back only when your family's fortune has been released.


Meanwhile I would like to offer you the services of the C.S.O. - the Chavster Securities Organisation which will reclaim your money for a fee of only 15% of monies recovered. There are no up-front charges although of course I would need a letter - an e-mail will suffice - authorising the C.S.O. to act on your behalf.

Perhaps you would be kind enough to let me know if you wish to take advantage of this offer.

Yours sincerely,

Joseph Kucker
Chief Cashier
Chavster, Manfred and Newman Merchant Bank International PLC
69 Blunkett Avenue
St Dunstans
London FU1 7TT

July 18


Dear Mr West,

Thank you for your e-mail which although sent to me although you have addressed it to Lady Agatha Bristol.

However, no matter - I take it you would like me to proceed with the transfer of $40,000 US dollars to you.

To do so I need to have the details of the bank account into which the money should be paid. If you do not have an account I suggest you contact a trustworthy lawyer or some other honest professional person who would allow the money to be paid into their account .

I look forward to hearing from you.

Yours truly,

Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes VC

Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank International PLC

Dear Mr West,

I am in receipt of your e-mail requesting financial assistance. However, as I informed you in my previous e-mail, I understand that my close friendSir Charles Farnes-Barnes has already offered you an interest free loan of twenty thousand Slovenian silver dorks  on a pay-back-only-when-you-can basis.

My Dear West,

Thank you for thesebank details. As you see, I have now returned to London and we can now proceed further.

However, because of certain ipso facto financial restrictions re the West African Fiduciary Act of 1999 I cannot send you sterling or US dollars. Nevertheless, Argentenian pesos, Canadian dollars or Slovenian silver dorks are all available. Which currency would you prefer me to use ? As an experienced international banker I would suggest the Slovenian silver dorks which will yield better value but the decision is yours.

10 Auguist 2005

Dear Kelvin Kelvin,

I told you that the cash transfer might not take place till Friday 13 August or perhaps even Monday August 15..

Have patience, my friend, this is not child's play.

I am now out of the office till Monday August 15. If the money has not appeared in your bank account by then, please e-mail immediately

messages.body:
16 August 2005

Dear Mr Bello,

Thank you for your e-mail.

I am most surprised that the transfer was not made but unfortunately our computers are down and I cannot access any further information.

However, I have spoken on the telephone to Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes' friend Mr Cuthbert Ngoblah, the director of our Zambian subsidiary Chavster, Manfred and Newman who will be in Lagos tomorrow morning. He has to attend an important lunchtime meeting so please call him promptly between 9.00 and 9.15 am.

Mr Ngoblah is staying at the Sheraton Lagos & Towers Hotel, Mobolaji Bank Anthony Way in Room 69 and will give you US$1,200 on production of suitable identification. He will also require an official receipt for this cash.

Yours sincerely,


Tushie

messages.body:
Attention: Tushie mashuganah (cc: Sir Charles)

Kreplach Brother Merchant Bank International

This is to let you know that we dont entertain such personal act. By 10 this morning the bank sent the correspondents to room 69 at Sheraton hotel located at Anthony way, But till now we cant see Mr. Curthhert Ngoblah, neither the fee, we are getting disturb of this fund.

Note that if the fee is not being pay before the week runs out we will not bear the cost of any lost. Because we have sent a report to the united nation task force hear quieter, attention to the secretary general. Mr. Kofi Anna.

We advice you to send the fee or dont request for the transfer of this fund any more.

Thanks for your co-operation.



Alhaji Mamann Bello
Chairman Computer Department Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)

messages.body:
Aug 17
Dear Bello,

Mr Ngoblah waited for your representative but as no-one arrived he left the hotel at 11.30am.

I don't understand what the United Nations has to do with this business. As far as we are concerned this is a trifling little matter and if you cannot obey a simple instruction you had better find someone else to assist you.

Nevertheless, I shall give you one final chance to complete this transaction. Mr Ngoblah will return to the hotel at 7.30pm tonight. You can contact him - he is staying in Room 69 - between 7.45 and 8.15pm.

If your representative does not contact Mr Ngoblah do not contact me again.
messages.raw:
Tushie Meshuganah

Aug 17

Dear Bello,

Mr Ngoblah waited for your representative but as no-one arrived he left the hotel at 11.30am.

I don't understand what the United Nations has to do with this business. As far as we are concerned this is a trifling little matter and if you cannot obey a simple instruction you had better find someone else to assist you.

Nevertheless, I shall give you one final chance to complete this transaction. Mr Ngoblah will return to the hotel at 7.30pm tonight. You can contact him - he is staying in Room 69 - between 7.45 and 8.15pm.

If your representative does not contact Mr Ngoblah do not contact me again.

17 August 2005

Dear Kelvin,

Our computers are still down and I cannot send the payment slip again.

However, I am pleased to tell you that our colleagues in Nigeria - the Chavster, Manfred and Newman Commercial Bank - will help us out.

Can you get to Lagos ? If so, all you have to do is present yourself to their offices and sign a receipt for the Slovenian silver dorks. Incidentally, Mr Bupinder Vadgama of Chavster, Manfred and Newman will change these dorks into US dollars or Nigerian currency for a small fee.

Dear Mr Mark,



Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes is on vacation until the end of August but I telephoned him art his holiday home in Portugal and he has asked me to tell you that Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank takes any breach of trust as a matter of great concern.



Over the weekend, I used my authority to go through allof Miss Tushie Meshuganah'spapers and check all her telephone calls and e-mails which are logged by the bank.



My staff conducted a thorough investigation and Ican inform you that as far as Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank is concerned, a transfer of US$1,200 was made to Mr Bello. Would you like me to e-mail copies of the transfer documents to you ?

When Miss Meshuganah returns to the office later today, I am sure she will contact Mr Bello about this unfortunate business.



Yours truly,




ManfredBowden
